title: Is Adobe inDesign a suitable application for designing websites? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends. Are you designing wireframes and lo-fi concepts? If you are, then sure, InDesign is fine. But, if you are trying to create hi-fi concepts, then no, InDesign lacks the control over graphics, filters, textures … that Photoshop has in its tools. It also has quite the overhead for just doing wireframes and such, but it does have really nice typographic controls. But, a really nice compromise between the two is Illustrator. Illustrator is actually a really good design program for conceptualizing websites. The contraints it has is actually a really good thing. It offers enough to get a good job done, but lacks all of the crazy crap that Photoshop has that can get you in trouble. I will now take this opportunity to recommend not to spend too much time building elaborate hi-fi concepts in graphics programs. Learn to design in the browser as soon as you can. In the long run, you will end up with a more efficient and effective process; that is, if you know how to code :)
